event.name: NEBULA_ZOLTAN_EYE
event.text: Inside this nebula you detect a rogue planet drifting through space, on its surface a huge monolith visible at this distance even to the naked eye. A Zoltan elder hails you from the planet. "Through luck or intent, you have discovered the Great Eye. Look into its depths and receive your just deserts."

As you approach, an ancient alien voice speaks to you: "Your mission has brought you great battles, and great losses. This will help ease the pain." A few minutes later someone reports medical equipment has appeared on the ship!
You approach the planet and wait, but nothing happens. The Zoltan hail: "And in the coming times, when the monolith speaks not with a man he has no future and must be left wanting."

You approach the planet carefully, trying to keep your ship from breaking up in orbit. The monolith, whatever it is, must sense as much because the next thing you know you have enough scrap to patch up your damage and more besides!

As you approach, a kaleidoscope of colors fills the viewscreen and one of your crew begins to age rapidly in reverse, eventually disappearing into nothingness. Let's hope they've transcended physical existence, and not just been forced out of it.

removeCrew.text: You check your Cloning Bay but it lies dormant. Whatever just happened to your crewmember must be irreversible.

event.text: Your mission is to save the Federation, not discover new wonders around the galaxy. You prepare to jump.

event.name: STORM_ZOLTAN_SUPPLY_CHOICE
event.text: You spy two pirate ships lurking in the nebula here. They remain unaware of your presence; you're able to get your scanners to at least identify their cargo: One is carrying the fuel supplies, the other the ammunition. They begin to drift away from each other in the storm.
You jet toward the pirate with the fuel supplies and engage - hopefully you can leave the ship in one piece!

destroyed.text: The ship obliterated, only scant fuel canisters can be scavenged from the wreckage before the ion storm clears and you have to jump away.

deadCrew.text: With the ship in one piece, you are able to salvage most of the fuel supplies before the ion storm clears and you have to jump away.

event.text: You jet toward the pirate with the ammunition and engage - hopefully you can leave the ship in one piece!

destroyed.text: The ship obliterated, only scant ammunition crates can be scavenged from the wreckage before the ion storm clears and you have to jump away.

deadCrew.text: With the ship in one piece, you are able to salvage most of the ammunition before the ion storm clears and you have to jump away.

event.text: Sometimes discretion is the better part of valor.

event.name: STORM_ZOLTAN_BUYING_CREW
event.text: Despite the harsh conditions, the Zoltan ship is stationed at the beacon. They contact you: "We are willing to purchase living organic lifeforms. They would need to undergo some experiments related to survival in severe environments."

choice.text: Sell one of your crewmembers as a test subject.

event.text: One of your brave crewmembers volunteers to become a subject of Zoltan experiments. The Zoltan ship transfers some scrap metal as payment.
The Zoltans are charging their weapons and getting ready to strike back. The plasma storm favors them as they're able to provide power to their systems using their innate energy.
"You don't understand. We need to conduct the experiments. It is necessary for the survival of our species." The Zoltans attack!
These Zoltans just don't get it. Your crew is your property. Only you can conduct experiments on them.

event.name: STORM_ZOLTAN_LANIUS_SCAN
event.text: A Zoltan ship is beset by plasma storm and is completely focused on an unidentified ship deep inside a nebula cloud. Closer inspection show that the distant ship belongs to the Lanius and lies completely dormant.

choice.text: Get closer and scan the Lanius ship.

event.text: As soon as you scan the Lanius ship, it activates. The Zoltan vessel immediately jumps away leaving you alone. A Lanius ship, hungry for scrap, targets you.

The Zoltan ship intercepts you: "The unidentified ship is very dangerous. We cannot allow unauthorized access to it." The Zoltan ship engages you and forces you to move away from the Lanius ship, eventually losing it from sight.

choice.text: Ask the Zoltans about the Lanius.

event.text: The Zoltan captain answers: "This metal ship belongs to the Lanius. It's very dangerous but we managed to capture one of these alive."

choice.text: Offer to buy a Lanius into your crew.
Offer to rid the Lanius ship of hostile lifeforms.

event.text: The Zoltan captain is delighted: "That would advance our research immensely. We will gladly pay you for this service." You attack the Lanius ship. Remember, you promised to keep the ship itself intact.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart. The Zoltans are very disappointed and you give up on salvaging the remains of the ship offering this opportunity to them.

deadCrew.text: No more life signs detected on the Lanius ship. The Zoltans are ecstatic and offer all of their scrap and a new weapon in exchange for your service.

choice.text: Ignore the ships and charge FTL drive.

event.text: Suddenly, a Lanius ship awakes! The Zoltan vessel immediately jumps away leaving you alone. A Lanius ship, hungry for scrap, targets you.
The Zoltan ship didn't even notice your arrival and departure.
